intro: Bursaria cayzerae, commonly known as the Cayzera bursaria, is a small shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salinity and wind exposure. Bursaria cayzerae is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
